intro: Erlangea westii, commonly known as the Westii erlanga, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, large, and showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has a woody stem with smooth, dark green leaves that are oval in shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Erlangea westii is considered a species of conservation concern.
